attributes.action: Release SAS Hero Albert Patterson Immediately
attributes.additional_details:
Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3540966/SAS-hero-jailed-Falklands-War-gun-trophy-Former-soldier-sentenced-15-months-keeping-9mm-pistol-remind-22-friends-died-conflict.html#ixzz45sqfoWQV 
Follow us: @MailOnline on Twitter | DailyMail on Facebook
attributes.background:
An SAS hero was yesterday jailed for the illegal possession of a souvenir weapon captured in the Falklands War.
He served for 22 years, in the Parachute Regiment and then in the SAS.
He spent a great deal of time abroad protecting our country and our way of life.

rejection.details:
The Government and Parliament are not responsible for releasing people from prison. You could ask the Government to ask the Queen to exercise the prerogative of mercy.

You could also start a new petition calling on Parliament to change the law, to prevent cases like this happening in the future. This is likely to be more effective than asking for a court sentence to be overturned.
